name: places/ChIJ4Z3B_7FZwokR_feQlsVrC_w
formattedAddress: 315 W 33rd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
adrFormatAddress: 315 W 33rd St, New York, NY 10001, USA

originalText.text:
Lived at the Olivia for a year and we had a great experience.
Even if our lease started with a lot of elevator issues, it has gotten much better once they where all renovated.
The amenities are really nice and we never had any issues with our apartment.
Would recommend without a doubt.

text.text:

Would recommend without a doubt.

originalText.text:
The new building management (Brookfield) has completely ruined the building. The stereotype for Brookfield is true – all they care about is their bottom line so they cut costs literally everywhere they can.

- The gym used to be free
- The rooftop used to be free. How can they call themselves a luxury building if NONE of their amenities are included?
- They turn off the hot water without notice
- The elevators never work. I have waited 20+ minutes for an elevator before.
- The new package room has resulted in stolen packages
- there is so much renovation that there is constant loud drilling and hammering and poisonous fumes coming from inside the building
- The AC and heater break down a lot
- The rent is not cheap and they add on a bunch of hidden fees

*** My recommendation for current tenants: Break your lease and leave. I BROKE MY LEASE EARLY WITHOUT PAYING A FEE***

If you want a nice apartment in the area I would look at Solari, the Ritz Plaza, or the Avalon Midtown West. Also consider looking deeper into Hudson yards. Bonus: you’ll be further away from the chaos of Penn Station.

originalText.text:
Whoever is responsible for maintaining this building is a joke. The company tries to market the building as luxury but it lacks the most basic infra for example the elevators. Three out of 4 don't work. Yesterday all 4 went down and they asked people to take the stairs. Imagine living on 35th floor or having a disability. And this is not just one time thing. It's been happening every week for the last 3 months. There's other issues. They tell residents they are renovating gym, rooftop etc and it will be done in 3 months. Took them 6 months to finish and cherry on top they started charging for it. A thing which was free when you signed the lease. Won't be surprised if they start charging us for elevators

Edit: 04/07/23
And it's happening again. 20 min waiting to go up or down

Edit: 08/04/23

And again

Edit:
Updating the rating since i see improvements. After the elevator fixes, life's been better.

Edit:
Here for another year. Past few months have been smooth and no issues with the elevators. My move in process to a new apartment was really smooth as well. In my prev review i did not mention apartment quality. The apartments are really nice and well maintained. And in my experience more spacious than others i have seen in Manhattan. Updating my rating

originalText.text: The new management from Brookfield is the worst! I’ve been living in the building for 2 years and the new management just killed all the reasons I want to stay here. The elevator is ridiculous that waiting for 20+min or even walking up has become the norm. I had many packages or even items on the door stolen, and management does not care at all. They only want to make money and don’t care about the living standard of the residents. Renovations all the time but they even dare to raise the price by a lot when the building is under construction for a year… I highly NOT recommend this place if you want to find a real luxury apartment building.

They only want to make money and don’t care about the living standard of the residents. Renovations all the time but they even dare to raise the price by a lot when the building is under construction for a year… I highly NOT recommend this place if you want to find a real luxury apartment building.

originalText.text:
Do not live here. Since new management has come on it has been the worst experience of living I have ever had. We have been without gas in our apartment for 3 months and were given a measly 10% off rent (a joke of a fix). They also started charging people $100 to use their gym which is worse than the old gym on the 36th floor. Also now the rooftop costs $50 a month! I thought I signed up for an apartment with amenities included.

We have expressed concerns multiple times with the building and they just don’t care. Not worth paying over $4k a year for a FAKE luxury experience.

The only good thing about this building is the hardworking doorman and service workers, I wish they got some of the money they robbed from us.
